original: Lundqvist, Bo Gustav Verner V:son, rektor, fil. dr, Vänersborg, f. 20/2/01 i Skara av lärov:adj. Verner L. o. gymn:dir. Karin Plate. G. 35 m. skolkökslär. Inga Heüman. Barn: Katarina Bosdotter f. 37, Dag Boson 40. — Stud:ex. i Skara 19, stud. i Upps. 19, fil. kand. 23, fil. mag. 25, fil. lic. 34, fil. dr 35, allt i Upps. Arkiv-forskn. i Köpenhamn, Kiel o. Berlin 30, 31, 34, res. t. Danm., Finl., Norge o. Tyskl. ett flert. gånger, t. Belg. o. Frankr. 20, t. Ital., Jugoslov., Österr. o. Tjeckoislov. 22. Vik. adj. i Skara 22, lär. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 30-34, e. o. lekt. i Lidingö 36-38, lär. v. Sthlms borgarsk. 36-38, lekt. v. h. a. 1. i Umeå 37, lär. v. Umeå hand :gymn. 40-45, rekt. v. h. a. 1. i Vänersb. sed. 47. Andre kur. v. Västgöta nat. i Upps. 2&-29, bibi. där 27, v. Upps. stud :kårs bibi. 32-34, v. Lidingö lärov. 36-38, v. Umeå lärov. 43-47, huv:red. f. Vestro-gothica 28-40, led. av Sv. Rotaryråd. ised. 45, led. av Stadshist. ins;t. nd sed. 43, led. av stadsfullm. i Umeå samt av div. utsk. o. komm. und. olika per., led. av styr. f. Vänersb. mus. sed. 47, ordf. i Sv.-Finl. stud:förb. 31-32, ordf. i Umeå tjänstem :sällsk. 42-47, styr:-medl. fr. 38, ordf. i Umeå hum. förb. 42-47, sekr. 40-41, ordf. i styr. f. Umeå komm. flicksk. 44-47, presid. i Umeå Rotarykl. 44-46, sekr. o, v. pres. 40-44, ordf. i Västerb ikrets. av fören. Norden 46-47, v. ordf. o. ordf. i Umeåavd:s arb :utsk. 43-45, 46-47, omb. f. Radiotjänst o. programchef v. Umeå rundradio’Stat. 43-47. Skr.: Sverige o. den slesvig-holsteinska frågan (ak. avh. 34), Falköp. hist. I-III (40 -46), Västgöta nat. i Upps. fr. år 1595, Biiogr. anteckn., bd I 1595-1720 (28-46), Den yngre grenen av släkt. Heü-man (48), upps. i Hist. tidskr. m. fl, art. i Nord. Famibok, kult. medarb. i Umeblad. 41-47, rec. i Gbgs-Posten, föredr., kås. o. report, i radio. Hobby: Sveriges kommunikationer.
translated: Lundqvist, Bo Gustav Verner V:son, principal, Ph.D., Vänersborg, b. 20/2/01 in Skara to high school teacher Verner L. and gymnasium director Karin Plate. Married in 1935 to home economics teacher Inga Heüman. Children: Katarina Bosdotter b. 1937, Dag Boson b. 1940. Education: High school diploma in Skara in 1919, student in Uppsala in 1919, Bachelor of Arts in 1923, Master of Arts in 1925, Bachelor of Arts (honorary degree) in 1934, Ph.D. in 1935, all degrees obtained in Uppsala. Archive research in Copenhagen, Kiel, and Berlin in 1930, 1931, and 1934, respectively. Multiple trips to Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Germany, and visits to Belgium and France in 1920, Italy, Yugoslavia, Austria, and Czechoslovakia in 1922. Temporary high school teacher in Skara in 1922, teacher at Fjellstedt School in Uppsala from 1930-1934, temporary lecturer in Lidingö from 1936-1938, teacher at Stockholm High School from 1936-1938, lecturer at the Higher Commercial School in Umeå in 1937, teacher at Umeå Handheld Gymnasium from 1940-1945, principal at the Higher Agricultural School in Vänersborg since 1947. Second curator at Västgöta National Museum in Uppsala from 1922-1929, librarian there in 1927, librarian at Uppsala Student Union Library from 1932-1934, librarian at Lidingö High School from 1936-1938, librarian at Umeå High School from 1943-1947. Editor-in-chief of Vestro-gothica from 1928-1940, member of the Swedish Rotary Council since 1945, member of the City Historical Institute since 1943, member of the City Council in Umeå and various committees and commissions during different periods, member of the Board of Directors for Vänersborg Museum since 1947, chairman of the Swedish-Finnish Study Association from 1931-1932, chairman of the Umeå Civil Servants Society from 1942-1947, board member since 1938, chairman of the Umeå Humanities Association from 1942-1947, secretary from 1940-1941, chairman of the Board of Directors for Umeå Community Girls' School from 1944-1947, president of the Umeå Rotary Club from 1944-1946, secretary and vice president from 1940-1944, chairman of the Västerbotten district of the Association of Norden from 1946-1947, vice chairman and chairman of the Umeå branch's work committee from 1943-1945, 1946-1947, representative for Radiotjänst and program director at Umeå Public Radio Station from 1943-1947. Publications: Sweden and the Schleswig-Holstein question (doctoral thesis, 1934), Falköping history I-III (1940-1946), Västgöta National Museum in Uppsala from 1595, Biographical notes, vol. I 1595-1720 (1928-1946), The younger branch of the Heüman family (1948), essays in the Historical Journal and others, articles in the Nordic Family Book, cultural contributor to Umeblad from 1941-1947, book reviews in Gbgs-Posten, lectures, essays, and reports on radio. Hobby: Sweden’s communications.
